Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Kids in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Kids in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown. And children in Arlington are much better off than their counterparts in North Memphis.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: And children in Arlington are much better off than their counterparts in North Memphis.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Kids in Cordova are far safer from lead poisoning than kids in Midtown. And children in Arlington are much better off than their counterparts in North Memphis.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Kids raised in Memphis’ suburbs face little risk of lead poisoning since few homes there were built after 1978.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Kids raised in Memphis’ suburbs face little risk of lead poisoning since few homes there were built after 1978.

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Children in these neighborhoods primarily ingest lead from dust in their homes and yards.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: Children in these neighborhoods primarily ingest lead from dust in their homes and yards.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Over 75% of the homes in both ZIP codes were built before 1980, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Document Sources.Source Justification: according to the U.S. Census Bureau

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In South Memphis, for instance, about 96% of residents are Black, and about 91% of homes were built prior to 1978, according to the U.S. Census Bureau.
Document Sources.Source Justification: according to the U.S. Census Bureau
